Action: Return missing archive units to the system to resume MTree replication for this context. If the archive units cannot be restored, contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: An active replication context is in error because the target software is incompatible with this system. Replication is halted until this condition is resolved. Action: Upgrade the target software to a compatible version. If the problem persists, contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: An active collection replication context is in error because the target settings are incompatible with this system. Replication is halted until this condition is resolved. Action: Change the target settings to match this system. If the problem persists, contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Enter the system passphrase if it is missing. Delete and reimport the current host certificate if it is corrupted. In all cases, the Enterprise Manager needs to be restarted. If the condition persists, contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: Failure occured when adding the timeserver(s). Action: Determine the cause of the error and retry the operation.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

This may indicate a serious condition that may need to be addressed by support. The system is unable to accept additional commands. Action: If this condition persists, contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

The system will not be able to send out any email notifications that includes alerts, autosupports and daily summary emails. Action: Make sure that the mail server is configured correctly. Verify the configured mail server by sending out a test email from the system. If the problem persists, contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

The system will not be able to send out any notifications, including alerts, autosupports and daily summaries, through this gateway. Action: Ensure the configured ESRS gateway is accessible from the DD system. If the problem persists, contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com

Description: Current number of snapshots for an Mtree is at 90% or more of the maximum number of snapshots allowed. Action: Consider expiring existing snapshots of that Mtree with the 'snapshot expire' command or adjusting scheduled snapshot retention periods with the 'snapshot schedule modify' command.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: Data Domain system has a limit on the number of existing snapshots held at once for a single Mtree. Once this limit is reached no more snapshots can be created of that Mtree. Action: Consider expiring existing snapshots of that Mtree with 'snapshot expire' command to make room for newer ones.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: Indicates that sanitization will be run in multiple iterations. In the worst case this can take 15-20 days for 280 TBs. It means that the system will not run at full speed for that period of time and that GC will not be run to reclaim space. However, sanitization will also reclaim space back but it might not be as efficient as GC is. Action: Make sure that you have enough space to not run out of space and that you can wait that many days in the worst case. You should have at least 20% of physical space available. Other option is to abort sanitization, delete a bunch of files and try again. You can do this process iteratively until you do not get this alert anymore.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: /ddvar might soon run out of space to save system core dumps. Action: Remove unwanted files from /ddvar to free up some space. Lack of space can result in missing core dumps that will hamper debugging operations.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: Space usage has exceeded the configured warning threshold capacity Lack of space can result in loss of file system functionality or missing important logs. Action: Free space in the specified tier or unit by deleting unneeded items and running cleaning on the tier. If items cannot be deleted, storage must be added to the appropriate tier. If you need assistance recovering space, contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com. To purchase additional storage, please contact your EMC sales representative or channel partner.

Description: Space usage has exceeded the configured critical threshold capacity Lack of space can result in loss of file system functionality or missing important logs. Action: Free space in the specified tier or unit by deleting unneeded items and running cleaning on the tier. If items cannot be deleted, storage must be added to the appropriate tier. If you need assistance recovering space, contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com. To purchase additional storage, please contact your EMC sales representative or channel partner.

Description: A hardware fault has been detected for this drive. The drive or the cabling to it may have a problem. Action: Contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com.

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: The disk temperature has exceeded a specified threshold. If the temperature continues to increase, the system could fail or the system could be shut down. Action: If the temperature is high due to high activity for a short period, it should return to normal in a short time. Verify the environment is at its normal temperature. If not, correct this condition. Check for fan failures and free air flow. If the problem persists, contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com.

diskTemperature %parm[#2]%;

Description: One or more disks have exceeded the shut down temperature threshold. The system is shutting down. Action: Verify the environment is at its normal temperature. If not, correct this condition. Check for fan failures and free air flow.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

Description: The disk capacity is too small for it to be of any use in the system. Action: Replace with a larger capacity disk.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

diskSerialNumber %parm[#2]%;

Description: One or more critical disks/LUNs are unavailable. Action: Make sure all storage is securely connected. Look at alert history for any path failures. Check for any core files, a critical layer may be unavailable. Verify that all storage is working and recognized correctly.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: One or more disks are failed and the RAID reconstruction is not running. Action: Make sure there is/are spare disk(s) in the system.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: Two or more disks are failed and the RAID protection is in critical state. If an additional disk fails, there might be permanent loss of data. The system will shut down if the problem is not fixed. Action: Make sure there is/are spare disk(s) in the system.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: Two or more disks are failed and the RAID protection is in critical state for over a considerable period of time. If an additional disk fails, there might be permanent loss of data. The system will shut down. Action: Restart the system and make sure there is/are spare disk(s) in the system.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: Two or more disks are failed and the RAID protection is in critical state for over a considerable period of time. If an additional disk fails, there might be permanent loss of data. Action: Make sure there is/are spare disk(s) in the system.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: Disk is unknown. Action: Add disk to the system.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: Not enough spare disks can be detected for this tier. There may be failed disks or connectivity issues with disks or enclosures. Action: Replace any failed or absent disks. Check enclosure connectivity.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: Raid on LUN from 4.8 is no longer supported. Please follow instruction on how to increase usable space in your filesystem. Action: 1) migrate data away 2) do a filesystem destroy 3) add your LUN 4) migrate data back

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: The enclosure is unusable by the filesystem. Storage configuration can not be modified while a foreign device is present. Action: If this is expected as part of a chassis swap or chassis upgrade, proceed with the headswap operation to make the foreign filesystem available. Otherwise contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

enclosureListNum %parm[#2]%;

Description: The SSD has reached end of life and could fail at any time. The system may shut down unexpectedly if the drive is not replaced. Action: Contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

diskSerialNumber %parm[#2]%;

Description: There are too many disks reporting read errors in the same RAID group. As each of these disks completes reconstruction it will be failed. If the ongoing RAID reconstruction fails, there might be permanent loss of data. Action: Contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com to determine the number of drives that need to be replaced.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: This system only supports certain drive models. The unsupported drives are unusable and must be replaced for proper system operation. Action: Identify and remove/replace the unsupported drives. For assistance, contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: Mixing drive types within an enclosure is not supported and may cause unexpected system behavior. Action: Ensure that all drives within the enclosure are of the same type. For assistance, contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: Critical storage resources are unavailable, preventing the tier from functioning. Action: Verify all storage is functional and configured correctly. If the problem persists, contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: All data has been moved from old enclosures to the new enclosures. Storage migration must be finalized to decommission old enclosures and add new capacity to the file system. Action: Finalize the storage migration.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: The system has detected a condition which prevented the storage migration from continuing and has suspended the data copy phase. Action: Contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: An administrator has suspended the data copy phase of storage migration. Data copy cannot proceed until it is manually resumed. Action: Resume the storage migration.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: The enclosure pack is unusable by the file system. Storage configuration can not be modified while a foreign device is present. Action: If this is expected as part of a chassis swap or chassis upgrade, proceed with the headswap operation to make the foreign filesystem available. Otherwise contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

enclosurePackID %parm[#2]%;

Description: The purpose of the cache tier is to optimize file system performance. Having less than the licensed capacity will not maximize the performance gain. Action: Add cache storage to reach the licensed capacity. If a cache storage unit has failed, it must be replaced.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: A faulty disk has been identified and it cannot be failed at this time. Performance will be degraded. Action: Contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: The enclosure installed with SSD drives is not supported type. Action: Refer to the configuration guide to replace the unsupported enclosure.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: Enhanced performance provided by the cache tier will not be realized until filesystem is restarted. Action: Verify the cache tier is in use. If it is not, restart the filesystem.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: A hardware fault has been detected for this drive. The drive or the cabling to it may have a problem. Action: Contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

diskSerialNumber %parm[#2]%;

Description: The disk is reporting recoverable errors and needs attention. Action: Review the cause code and replace the disk if necessary. If the problem persists, contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

diskSerialNumber %parm[#2]%;

Description: The purpose of the cache tier is to optimize file system performance. Having less than the required cache tier capacity will not maximize the performance gain. Action: Add cache storage to reach the required cache tier capacity. If a cache storage unit has failed, it must be replaced.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: The system is currently unable to correctly determine and report the state of all physical disks. Hardware faults on the disks will be undetected by the system. Action: Power cycle the Data Domain system. If the problem persists, contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: System performance may be reduced due to a missing/failed cache tier drive. Action: Replace the missing/failed cache tier drive(s), or add a drive to the cache tier.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: System performance may be reduced due to lower than expected number of active tier drive packs. Action: Add more packs to meet the minimum required.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: An OS drive has failed or is about to fail and the system is in a critical state. If an additional OS drive fails the system will shut down. Action: Replace failed or copy recovery OS drive.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: Some or all of the telemetry information not transmitted to CloudIQ. The CloudIQ analysis based on the data may be incomplete. Action: If the problem persists, contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: During the upgrade process, there was an error that requires manual intervention. The system is not usable. Action: Contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: The DD OS upgrade is completed successfully. The system will be ready to use when the filesystem is enabled. Action: No action required.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: DD OS upgrade is in progress. The system will not be available for backup and restore operations. The alert will be cleared after the upgrade operation is complete. Action: Allow the upgrade operation to complete. If the upgrade takes longer than usual, contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: One or more errors occurred in firmware upgrade, new firmware features will not be available. Action: Retry DD OS upgrade using the 'force' option with the same version. Contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: VDisk configuration does not match SCSI Target configuration. Non-matching devices are not available and must be deleted or repaired. Action: Contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: The tape volume was adjusted to the last consistent data position during VTL recovery. Recent pending updates to the volume may have been discarded. Action: Verify that any backup sent to the affected tape at the time of this alert completed successfully. Reissue the backup if necessary.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: VTL directory pool and a VTL mtree pool have been detected with the same name. Viewing pool information will only retrieve tapes from the mtree pool. Tapes in the directory pool will not be visible to DataDomain system administration interfaces. Backups and restores using the directory pool will operate normally. Action: Rename one of the pools to make the name unique. The duplicate pool name may have been created as part of a replication pair.If problem persists, contact your contracted support provider or visit us online at https://support.emc.com

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: VTL is enabled. VTL functionality is available to the user. Action: Some backup applications may need manual rescanning for devices.

systemSerialNumber %parm[#1]%;

alertInfoDescription %parm[#2]%;

Description: VTL is disabled. VTL functionality is unavailable to the user. Action: No Action required.
